title: 113_s2005
content: The Act may be cited as the "CLEAR Cost Information Act of 2013" and requires reporting of certain hospital payment data. The Social Security Act is amended to include new subparagraphs related to hospital payment data reporting. The Social Security Act is amended to include new subparagraphs requiring subsection (d) hospitals to report payment data to the Secretary. Hospitals must submit data on amounts collected from uninsured and insured patients for common procedures over the past 2 years. The Social Security Act now mandates subsection (d) hospitals to report payment data to the Secretary. This includes data on amounts collected from uninsured and insured patients for the 50 most common diagnosis-related groups and ambulatory payment classification groups over the past 2 years. The reporting of data must be transparent to the public and made available on a publicly accessible website for meaningful comparisons by zip code. The Secretary is required to post hospital payment data on a public website for comparison by zip code and consumer understanding. Hospitals must include a link to this data on their own website. These amendments apply to contracts entered into or renewed after the enactment of this Act. The Act mandates that MedPAC's annual reports to Congress include information on the percentage of charity care provided by hospitals. Additionally, a report on charity care trends must be made publicly available for certain hospitals. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act now requires the Secretary of the Treasury to post hospital data on a publicly accessible website for consumer comparison by zip code. Additionally, hospitals must provide a link to this data on their homepage as per Medicare requirements. The Social Security Act is amended to require hospitals to include a link on their website to data posted under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act. These amendments apply to contracts entered into or renewed after the enactment of this Act.
